content.description: Start low on the right side of the face. Hands on small crimps. Using the right arete, climb the slab up and top out.
content.location: Problem is visible from the trail. To the right of Gym Dandy.

content.description: Start with both hands matched on the left triangle break in the arete. Feet smear. Head right looking for sidepulls and crimps until you can top out straight up the tallest part of the boulder.
content.location: This problem is visible from the trail.

content.description: Starts on small left hand crimp and write hand side pull. Move out right using the slopers. Top out using slopers and right arete.
content.location: Boulder is visible from the trail.

content.description: Start on left side arete. Traverse right, using both horizontal cracks and avoiding the top. Upon reaching vertical crack, Top out to the left of the vertical crack.
content.location: In the center area of the cliffs that stretch between the powerline clearing and the roof rock.

content.description:
Sit start underneath the left side of the boulder with hands on the low right shelf. Feet underneath the boulder. Head out and up to finish on some fun slab.

 V0 if you start on the face.
content.location: Pretty far down. Just before you reach the powerline clearing. It is on the other side of the One in the Stink boulder.

content.description: Start with hands high, the left in the crack and the right in a good pocket. Follow the widening vertical crack through an overhanging shelf at top. Finding a convenient root for a handhold keeps the top out relaxed but other options exist for the purist.
content.location: Walk past Roof Rock.  Before you get to the power line clearing, you will cross a gully that comes down to the trail, with rocks scattered on both sides of the gully.  There is a large anvil shaped free standing boulder about 100 ft uphill from the trail on the right side of this gully. This problem is on the uphill side of the boulder.

content.description: Collection of shorter but solid rocks along cliffline. Potential for a few more slabby and slopey problems.
